metadata.feature_description: Manages placement and movement of modules within content layout columns/panes.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Move module between panes within same Content Layout

steps.action: Navigate to home page and enable Edit mode
steps.expected: Edit mode should be active with pane labels and module action menus visible
steps.actual: Edit mode activated successfully, Content Layout panes F30A_Pane1-4 and 9977_Pane1-4 visible with module labels

steps.action: Hover over TELEVISIONS module in F30A_Pane1 to reveal action menu
steps.expected: Module action menu should appear with Admin and Move options
steps.actual: Module action menu appeared showing 358:Televisions with Admin (gear) and Move (arrows) buttons

steps.action: Click Move button to see available pane destinations
steps.expected: Move menu should show list of available panes including Content Layout panes
steps.actual: Move menu displayed with Down, Bottom, and To [PaneName] options including F30A_Pane2-4 and 9977_Pane1-4

steps.action: Select 'To F30A_Pane4' to move TELEVISIONS module
steps.expected: Module should move from F30A_Pane1 to F30A_Pane4
steps.actual: Module successfully moved to F30A_Pane4 - F30A_Pane1 became empty showing 'Click to add' icons, F30A_Pane4 now shows both LAPTOPS and TELEVISIONS stacked vertically

steps.expected: Module should return to original pane
steps.actual: Module successfully moved back - layout restored to original state with each module in its own pane

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Move module between different Content Layout modules

steps.action: Click Move on CAMERAS module (in 9977_Pane4) and select 'To 9977_Pane1'
steps.expected: CAMERAS should move to 9977_Pane1 where HOME THEATERS is located
steps.actual: CAMERAS successfully moved to 9977_Pane1 - now shows two modules stacked (CAMERAS and HOME THEATERS), 9977_Pane4 became empty

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify module order preservation using Up/Down movement

steps.action: With 9977_Pane1 containing HOME THEATERS (top) and CAMERAS (bottom), click Move on CAMERAS
steps.expected: Move menu should show Top, Up, Down, Bottom options for reordering within pane
steps.actual: Move menu displayed with Top, Up, Down, Bottom ordering options plus destination panes

steps.action: Click 'Up' to move CAMERAS above HOME THEATERS
steps.expected: Module order should change - CAMERAS should appear first, then HOME THEATERS
steps.actual: Order successfully changed - 9977_Pane1 now shows CAMERAS first (top), HOME THEATERS second (bottom)

steps.action: Verify order persisted in Edit mode
steps.expected: New order should be visible in Edit mode DOM structure
steps.actual: Edit mode confirmed - 9977_Pane1 shows e128 (CAMERAS/357) before e137 (HOME THEATERS/354)

steps.action: Observe pane state after moving module out
steps.expected: Empty pane should display 'Click to add' handlers for text, image, and module
steps.actual: When TELEVISIONS moved from F30A_Pane1, the pane correctly showed three 'Click to add' icons (text, image, module) and 'Add Existing Module' link

steps.action: Verify 9977_Pane4 became empty after moving CAMERAS to 9977_Pane1
steps.actual: 9977_Pane4 correctly displayed empty state with 'Click to add text/image/module' handlers

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add module to Content Layout pane

steps.action: Click 'Click to add a module' in empty 9977_Pane4
steps.expected: Add Module dialog should appear with module list
steps.actual: Add Module dialog appeared correctly showing Recommended (Form, Visualizer) and All modules (HTML Pro, Account Login, etc.)

steps.action: Click on HTML Pro module to add it to the pane
steps.expected: HTML Pro module should be added to 9977_Pane4
steps.actual: Clicking HTML Pro caused a JavaScript error: 'TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined' in ModuleDialog.js. The module was not added to the Content Layout pane.

issues: JavaScript error when clicking to add module: 'TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading...)' in ContentEditorManager/Js/ModuleDialog.js:1025:30
Add Module dialog did not properly add the selected module to the Content Layout pane

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify pane visibility and labels in Edit mode

steps.action: Enable Edit mode and observe Content Layout pane structure
steps.expected: All panes should have visible labels and be properly identified
steps.actual: Edit mode displayed all pane labels correctly: F30A_Pane1-4 (first Content Layout with 4 columns), 9977_Pane1-4 (second Content Layout with 4 columns). Each pane shows its name as a label at the top.

observations: Content Layout creates dynamic panes using a unique prefix (e.g., F30A_, 9977_) followed by pane number
Move menu correctly lists all available panes on the page including Content Layout panes and regular skin panes
The data-parentpane attribute is used to track parent pane relationships for Content Layout modules
Empty panes in Content Layout correctly show the 'Click to add text/image/module' handlers from EditBarEmptyPane class
Module ordering within a pane (Top/Up/Down/Bottom) works correctly and changes are reflected in the DOM structure
The Add Module dialog appears correctly when clicking 'Click to add a module' in an empty Content Layout pane, but there is a JavaScript error that prevents the module from being added successfully
